phrase.item: There was a king.
He had a daughter.
His minister also had a daughter.
The girl knew everything that would happen seven years ahead.
One day the king told his minister,
"Our daughters have grown.
Let's come up with an idea to keep our children away from the eyes of friends and enemies.
We should build a castle for them far away from the city.
The castle will be built from pearl and other expensive stones.
They will need some guards".
One day the king's daughter and the minister's daughter went for a walk.
With the soldier, they [girls] did not see anything.
They returned.
The next day came.
Then the minister's daughter told the king's daughter,
"Why don't we go on a trip?"
The king's daughter said, "Traveling is one of the best things in the world."
Then again they left with their soldier.
They looked around, there was a hole and smoke was coming out of it.
The king's daughter told to the minister's daughter, "We should figure out what that smoke is."
The minister's daughter said,
"We might get caught by a bandit."
So they went, following the smoke.
They made their soldier return, they went there and saw that there are forty QRAQCHI who have hunted an animal and are making it kebab.
They were very happy that oh Mawlo [Lord], we haven't seen a female in the world.
It is great we caught these ladies.
Their house was made out of dirt.
They locked the [girls] in their room.
They had a plan that two brothers will sleep with them [girls] and then two more next.
The minister's daughter realized that they had gotten caught.
All the forty QRAQCHI sat and started eating the kebab.
The minister's daughter took the dagger and started to dig through the wall.
And she made a small door (a hole in the wall).
They ran away from there.
The king's daughter's brooch fell there.
The QRAQCHI's mother was in forty inside rooms [one inside the other].
The two brothers came inside [the house]
saying they are going to sleep with them [girls].
They came and saw that the door was closed and the small door (hole) was open.
They thought a lot, and found the king's daughter's brooch. They took it to their mother inside the forty rooms.
The king's daughter realized that she has lost her brooch.
She told the minister's daughter,
"I'm not going home without my brooch."
The thirty-nine QRAQCHI went hunting and one stayed with his mother to take care of her.
The minister's daughter thought for a while and turned herself into an old woman and came to the QRAQCHI.
She told the king's daughter,
"Don't go anywhere and stay in this fortress until I appear!"
In short, she went and started sweeping the QRAQCHIS front door.
These thirty-nine people came and saw that an old woman was walking around.
Their youngest brother was smart and he said,
"For what reason has the minister's daughter turned herself into an old woman."
His elder brother slapped him once,
and said,
"You don't compare the minister's daughter to this old woman.
One side of her face is the moon and another side is the sun."
Then they went hunting, and the unlucky one said,
"This old woman won't harm us.
Let's make her cook food for us".
From that day, the old woman became a maid.
On Friday, the children wash their mother's head.
They went to the market and bought forty bars of soap.
They had a cauldron with forty pot handles.
They put water in the cauldron.
A bunch of wood was fired and the cauldron water boiled.
The minister's daughter took the boiled water and poured it into the well where the the QRAQCHIS mother was.
Their mother died there.
Then she held the old woman's chin up and took the brooch. Then she came out, burned the jungle and left from there.
The smartest brother said,
"She [minister's daughter] killed our mother, burned our jungle and left."
All the brothers started hitting their smart brother saying, "We couldn't pick up the cauldron that had forty handles, how could the old woman pick it up?"
When they came from hunting, they saw that the jungle is burned, their mother was killed, then they thought,
The minister's daughter came to the fortress,
and told to the king's daughter,
"We are going to have quests, so cook different types of food, paint eggs in seven colors."
"Until now we had friends and soldiers as guards, from now on just myself."
Then Mekadar [an unlucky person] appeared with his brothers.
He pitched a tent out of the city and stayed there.
Then the unlucky one came alone to the minister's daughter.
He was served with different type of food and the minister's daughter told the king's daughter,
"Now wear different type of clothes."
The minister's daughter goes to a master [artisan] and gets thirty-nine kebab sticks.
She went and fried all thirty-nine people with the sticks.
She was guarding day and night.
She came and asked the unlucky one,
"Why did you come here?"
The Mekadar said,"I have brought poison." The minister's daughter replied. "We do not need any poison, but we have not seen poison as well."
"Can we see how it looks?"
They reached [the place] where the thirty-nine people were dead.
He came right away to the king's house, he brought a shovel and a pickaxe.
He buried his brothers.
He went to the king, willing to serve him.
So like that, seven years he served the king.
Seven years passed.
He [the boy] said:
"King, are there any questions and answers?"
"I also need to live my life."
He [the king] said: "
He [the boy] said, "Exept the minister's daughter, I am not going to marry anyone else."
The minister's daughter was inside the forty rooms reading books.
The next day came.
The king put a rope on his neck, and his wife wraped her hair around her neck and entered the minister's daughter's [room].
The minister's daughter was surprised saying: "Father, what happened to you that in this midnight you opened the door?"
The king said: "Oh dear, a dog had held my door." (refers to the boy that he wants to marry the girl from the family).
She was surprised.
She said: "Oh father, as you came and opened my door at midnight and thought I deserve that dog, so I agree".
The king came out and the unlucky boy asked him, "How was it?"
He [the king] said: "It worked."
Then the king held a seven days wedding.
He [king] celebrated [the wedding] and built a house from wood.
For married life, he [the boy] is not allowed to leave until the king falls asleep.
She went with her father and brought a calf to her father's throne and slaughtered it.
She brought a pumpkin and poured the blood inside the pumpkin.
And started to draw her picture.
She wore Alas (name of a cloth), started cutting the wood (wooden wall), and made a small door (hole).
And left from there.
The king and unlucky boy fell asleep.
The [minister's] daughter opened the king's safe, took his dagger and came out.
She opened the door and said: "minister's daughter is from one place to any place."
She threw the dagger.
The Alas (cloth) got wrapped in dagger.
The pumpkin spilt.
The small door opened.
The minister's daughter went to a city and saw the king's shephard had brought the cows.
The cowherd collects herbs and sells them in market and gets two loaves of bread.
The minister's daughter said: "Leave the herbs and let me get inside the big bag."
He [the cowherd] said: "Dear I need to tell you."
He said: "One day, if anyone asks if you have seen any young man
He put her inside the big bag and tied it on the bull.
Then Məkadar also came and said:
"Did you see a young [man]?"
He said, "Thousand and thousand cross this place, how should I know?"
The cowherd took his herd and left.
He reached home and his old woman [wife] came out.
She put the big bag down and said, "Oh, what are we going to eat for dinner that you brought this lady."
The minister's daughter saw two sculcap while she was riding on the bull. She has drawn [sewn] her pictures there.
She [the girl] said, "Dear, is there any food in this city?"
He replied, "Dear, money!"
She said, "Dear, now take the sculcap to the market and don't sell it until it is full of [money]."
The cowherd came and said, "Dear, take it [money]."
She took it and told him, "Hey dear, go and buy anything you want from the market.
So, she went and brought [stuff] and laid it in the room.
The next day he says, "Hey dear, take the money and let's go buy wood and build fortress and Qiblah from gold, pearl, and merdʒon (a type of stone)".
The castle was built.
The king and his minister went up to their tower and watched through binoculars that the herder's tower is higher than the king's [tower].
The king's son went out and checked through the binoculars that a lady came outside, and she was so [beautiful] as one side of her is sun and another is moon.
He came back right away to his room and lay down [saying] that his thirty-three (sic) teeth are in pain.
Ministers brought news to the the king that his son's thirty-three teeth are in pain.
The king right away ordered doctors to come.
He [the king] said, "Check my son's sickness."
The doctor replied.
He said, "His sickness is the minister's daughter."
The prince turned to his father and said, "Father, you don't love me,
The reason is, the minister's daughter's face is one side the sun and another is the moon (refers to being very pretty)."
They sent his minister saying, "Go and bring the herder we will hang him,
He has a daughter and he has hidden her.
Bring the herder here."
The king had a five year old tree; whoever sins will be hanged there.
The minister's daughter bravely went to the king, saying,
"Hey king, why are you going to hang the poor herder?"
Then they took [opened] the herder from the tree.
The prince said, "This is the lady."
Then they freed the herder.
The minister's daughter said, "Whoever wants to marry me should kill all my enemies and I will marry him."
Then the king gave a wedding [celebration] for seven days.
The wedding finished and they put them in one room.
By the door, guards were standing [to protect them].
Məkadar got aware of this [situation], came and started fighting.
He [the king] made the guards protect his son.
He killed all his [the king] son's guards.
The war continues several days; the king's army were all killed.
Məqadar came again and continued the war and killed all the [king's] army.
Again, bleeding started.
The minister came and [saw] that all the army were slaughtered.
The minister's daughter came out of her room and said,
"Hey king, do you have more army?"
The king said, "Except females, I don't have anyone left."
Then ths minister's daughter took a wood [stick] and left.
She went and [saw] that Məqadar was sleeping.
She took the dagger from the sheath and put the wood there instead.
She took the dagger and came.
At night time, Meqadar came.
He wanted to fight.
He came there was no more army.
He opened the door and [saw] that the prince was sleeping.
He said, "Hey minister's daughter, from where to where?"
She said,
"Unbeliever, attack is from you [first]."
Məqadar took his dagger right away and tried to attack the minister's daughter, but it was just a wood [instead of a dagger].
She said, "Now it's my turn to attack."
Now it's the minister's daughter turn to attack.
She hit the Məqadar and he parted into two like a melon.
In the morning the king got up and came and the king's daughter said, "Is the world night or day?"
He [the king] came and [saw] that all the fighters were fallen on the ground.
Then he took all the dead bodies out of the city.
Then he invited people from ------- to ------ and gave celebration for seven days and night.
Then they had a Muslim wedding.
They lived some days together.
One day a horse appeared from the cloud.
The minister's daughter rode it.
The prince came [and saw] that she is not there.
The minister's daughter passed some deserts, and in one valley she was stopped by three thieves.
She asked them, "What is your aim?"
They [the thieves] replied, "We like you, and we want to marry you."
She said, "How would it be possible, a lady with three men?"
"I have one condition."
"I throw an arrow with my hand and whoever brings the arrow first, I will marry that person."
Then she threw the arrow.
They all went after the arrow.
They got back she was not there.
Shortly, she left and said [to herself] that if she continues going she will be caught again.
Then she put on men's clothing.
She reached a city where their king has died.
They had an aim to play the game of wealth (they leave a bird and on whoever's shoulder it sits that person will become a king).
The minister's daughter tied her horse to a skinny [thing] far away from the city and came.
She entered the water room.
The bird of wealth was thrown.
It came and sat on a wall.
Again they took the bird back.
The right side minister said, "How come this bird of wealth is going to that side?"
The minister said, "Promises from Prophet are only three times."
He said, "Now, throw the bird of wealth!"
It flew again to the same place.
The minister ordered to check who is inside the mill.
The soldiers brough her out of the mill to the minister. The minister gathered all people and asked her on top of the tower.
"Oh people, what do you think?"
They all together said, "It has been from ancient time [the tradition is] when the bird of wealth sits on someone's shoulder that person becomes the king."
The bird of wealth was thrown and again it sat on the shoulder of minister's daughter.
Then they took her to the throne of the king.
She asked the minister of the right hand, "How many roads are in this country?"

He said, "There are three ways we have, except me if something comes through that way, do not let him go without me, otherwise I will take your house staff through sieve (refers to take away everything from the house)".
So on one day the three theives appeared.
She said, "Put them in jail!"
One day her husband, the prince came.
He [thief] said, "Take him to the guestroom, whatever you serve me, the same for him."
Seven years passed.
The king was on the throne.
She asked for the minister of the right hand,
and asked, "Minister, do the prisoners exist [live] or not?"
"First, bring the prince to me".
He was brought and she asked him, "What kind of person you are?"
He [the prince] replied, "I had a very nice wife, I have given my life for her."
"A dog or either animal would eat me." She said, "What kind of prince are you, because of your wife you are displaced?"
Then she made him sit next to her.
And she told the minster, "Go and bring those three [theives]."
She asked them,"What kind of people you are?'
They said, "A beautiful lady came and we all three wanted her, we held her horse's reins."
"And we told her we will marry you."
"She told us that she was puting a condition thats she throws an arrow by hand."
"Whoever brings the hand arrow first, she is going to marry him."
"When we came back she had gone."
The king asked, "Did you give her any hard time?"
They said, "No, she threw the arrow and we left; when we came back she wasn't there."
The king said, "Take them away."
Then she turned to the prince's side wondering if he is going to recognize his wife or not.
She took off the turban from her head and male clothes, the prince recognized her right away.
The she put the turban on prince's hard.
Put him in the king's throne.
And she became the minister of the right hand.
Much time passed, the minister was brought and put on the throne of the king.
She and the prince mounted their horse and went to the prince's house.
Fourteen years passed.
She came to her father's homeland, and told her father that his son-in-law came.
Then he put his son-in-law on the throne instead of him, and their kingdom and fate was settled.
Both, their wishes came true.
